DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate efficacy community-based intervention improve asthma management parent , child health care provider .
DOC.detailed_description: DESIGN NARRATIVE : Forty-two ( 42 ) elementary school urban Baltimore Washington , DC , serve recruitment site approximately 300 student moderate severe asthma enrol . All participant enrol A+ Asthma Program . Primary care practitioner student randomize minimal contact program A+ asthma physician partnership . They offer menu educational offering improve knowledge skill . The primary outcome measure emergency care use . Secondary measure include physician practice , hospitalization , health care utilization , restricted activity , medication use , school absence cop skill . The study completion date list record obtain `` End Date '' enter Protocol Registration Results System ( PRS ) record .
